meanings.definition: Full of or resembling knarls or knots.
meanings.sent1: The old tree had a knarry trunk that twisted and turned.
meanings.sent2: The knarry branches of the shrub created a unique pattern.
meanings.sent3: The knarry wood looked like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: Her knarry fingers moved deftly over the rough surface.
meanings.sent5: The knarry texture of the bark felt rough to the touch.

meanings.sent1: The knarry door was difficult to open due to its uneven surface.
meanings.sent2: The knarry table had a rustic charm to it.
meanings.sent3: The knarry pattern on the fabric added a unique touch to the design.
meanings.sent4: His knarry hands gripped the rough rope tightly.
meanings.sent5: The knarry texture of the rock made it hard to climb.

meanings.sent1: The knarry rope was strong and durable.
meanings.sent2: The knarry wood had a distinct appearance.
meanings.sent3: The knarry texture of the carpet made it difficult to clean.
meanings.sent4: Her knarry hair was difficult to comb through.
meanings.sent5: The knarry surface of the wall added character to the room.
